oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from James M Johnston to Marion Caudle Leake, dated November 1, 1918
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This letter is from James McFerren Johnston to his sister Marion Caudle (Johnston) Leake, while he was serving overseas during World War I. He addresses his sister as "Pig." The letter was written in France on American YMCA stationery. James McFerren Johnston served in HQ Co., Ord. Corps, attached to the 114th MG Battn., 30th Div. The 30th Div. consisted of National Guard units from Tennessee and the Carolinas and served under the British. Their nickname was the "Old Hickory" division.
